Item.Review: Pros: Great price; construction; materials; battery time, storage capacity, and design. Cons: Seemed heavy. Screen sensitivity and Wifi connectivity were slow and inconsistent. Greater issues: It's not the most current Android operating version and although claims are made about the availability of thousands of Android apps; unfortunately it's not true! Every concession I was willing to make to keep the tablet was thwarted by one or more shortcomings. I returned the Velocity tablet and ordered the eLocity A7 Tablet....Much better! But the absence of Android apps is still a significant disappointment.
Item.HelpfulCount: 2 out of 2 found this review helpful.

Item.ReviewTitle: Cant say enough about my new tablet!
Item.Review: I love the Cruz tablet. It does everything I need it to do and more. Had fun exploring the easy to navigate free aps and really love the freebies it offers. The price of $199 is perfect and so I got 2 of them. Still havent gone through all the things it has to off like downloads of pictures and sharing info but I will soon. Customer service is very helpful too. Dont pass up this great item, you will regret it.
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Review: As the name says it is a reader, and for that it does exactly what it says it does. I was skeptical when I had read the review, but, I am very satisfied with the work that this readers performance and operations. It was a good purchase for the money.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Review:
Once I ordered the Cruz tablet I couldn't wait for it to arrive. When I got it I found that the instruction were not very easy to follow for someone that was not familiar with computers. Since I was it wasn''t a problem. I was very disappointed in the performance of the unit. The touchscreen was very difficult to operate and while downloading the manual it froze-up completely and I had to turn it off and also hit the reset to restore the unit.. Did not perform as advertised. Seems to be well built but nor pleased with the operation overall so I sent it back.
Rity77 Jacksonville, FL

This tablet was really a bad purchase on my part. I knew it was too good too be true for the price. It never worked for me from the time I opened it up till the time I sent it back. It would not connect to the internet,it would not come on after several attempts. I even went as far as charging the battery over night and still nothing. I tried the reset button but to no avail. I would not recommend this product to anyone. Shopper beware!!!!
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Review:
This has been one of the best purchases I have made! I will start by saying I was looking for an e-reader that would do more in color. Also I am not a huge tech nerd so I won't be telling you how to crack this or get around that. I am using it how they intended, with the content provided.
I have been using it for about 3 days and have had no problems. I have read the mixed reviews, here is what I have found for myself.
*Came charged for instant use, Who doesn't want to play with it out of the box! *My wireless connection is fast but of course the "thinking" on the tablet is a touch slower. This I expected as it will depend on how close I sit to the router. Remember this is not a smart phone so it is not a network connection you are using Wi-Fi, I think that is where peo ... ple are expecting something different from the speed. *I have no problem getting into my hotmail or yahoo mail accounts. Set up was simple with the printed instructions my Cruz came with. * Kindle was easy to install (again follow the paper and it was a snap) * I can use both E-Boarders and Kindle for books which I like both are easy to navigate. * The touch screen is responsive. * There is a user guide in the CruzMarket to download, It took me a few minutes to find where it downloaded it. Nothing to difficult but could have been an easier way. * I haven’t transferred any music or photos yet I will be working on that today.
Over all I would say if you are looking for a nice alternative to the more expensive tablets this is for you. I am happy with the Cruz, I wasn’t expecting an I-pad to come out of the box though! For the Price I don’t know that you could do better! expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 2 out of 3 found this review helpful.

Item.Review: I received my tablet a few days ago, and to my surprise It was much better than the reviews give it credit for. I was tempted to buy another for a few dollars more but I am very happy with it. I did extensive research and for the price overall it was a great buy. It is one of the few tablets that is Wireless N, and includes 12 gb of storage . It was easy to set up in terms of the wireless connection and the screen is pretty responsive . My advice to anyone wanting a tablet is do extensive research first, know what you are looking for. I am a hardcore gamer but I do not expect to play games on every device I purchase, thats what consoles are for. But if you are looking for a great e-reader, with font control, backlit and the ability to surf the internet then this is the perfect device. The ... size is great for portability . And with value pay .. What else could you ask for . If your having issues with internet speed check your network . expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 2 found this review helpful.

Item.Review:
When I pulled my Cruz out of the box I was impressed at the feel and look of it. I charged it up and went to town on it.
There are only a few cons about the Cruz. 1. You cannot upgrade the Android OS 2. There is no access to the Android Apps Market 3. No Flash Memory, only SD Memory
Other than that, this is a very nice mid range tablet that I would definitely recommend to others.

Item.ReviewTitle: leave it, its not worth it.
Item.Review: i really wanted to like this tablet it was fuly charged out of the box a I used it the touch sensors are not very accurate the web pages close at any given moment right in the middle of surfing the web. Its a decent speed for the price, I just was not inpressed. It doesnt sync to yahoo email accounts which is just crazy. I will be returning this item, just not worth it

Right out of the box it performed flawlessly! WiFi connection got me on the internet with a breeze. I went to Velocity Micro for the firmware update that took only a few minutes and I was done.
I had some videos I took and they played but the quality wasn't anything to write home about-- could be the camera I used (RCA Small Wonder).
Pictures were clear. Music played well, but not with any great seduction.
I had no trouble with screen tap lag as the programs launced quickly, usually with one tap.
I'm still experimenting and will load some apps from online sources as soon as I can.
Some of the users here who are bashing this unit may have high expectations for a unit that doesn't claim to be what that big guy is and only paid $200 for. My unit worked flawl ... essly and that's all I can ask for what I paid for it.
I'm going to load a YouTube app to see whether I can view some videos, but if I can't, it's no biggie!! I'll just convert the YT videos and put them on the unit.
I'm completely satisfied with it and am more than satisfied with only a 2-day wait for delivery!! WOW!!!!!!!!! I didn't pay extra for quick delivery either-- go, ShopNBC!! expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Access in the Palm of my Hand
Item.Review: So easy to use rigt out of the box. Used for the past hour and still can't put it down. Love it and would highly recommend it to anyone who asks. Why pay so much more for the same thing, this is the one to get.

I'm very happy with my Cruz Tablet. From the moment I opened the box I started using it - it was that easy! Thank you! Within the first two days I'd loaded my pictures, music, downloaded new ebooks and set up my monthly planner - even checked my email - and I'm a newbie to techno gadgets! Cell phone and PC are my range of use.
I like the size and the key board is much easier to use than a phone. It is a bit heavy when reading, but a pillow prop helps...
While I'm still learning about it's many functions, I'm enjoying using the key features that work for me. I looked up their help site on my PC and download the User Guide. There is more to learn but so far, so good.

Item.ReviewTitle: Opinion about the Cruz T103 Android
Item.Review: The Cruz T103 Android is a good product but is advertised to be better then it really is. Being that it's the T103 and not the more advanced models many apps can not be downloaded to it. The Cruz T103 is a good product and its great for the price tag but after purchasing it I now know that I should have paid more for something else. But they say "You get what you pay for"!

No I would not recommend this product. I have already returned this Tablet. I found it to difficult to work with, especially setting up the different programs. Also, having the directions and information on line and not included in print made it complicated.

I purchased thia cruz tablet for my wife as a valentine gift, I waited until the last minute, and she received it a few days after the holiday, no big deal. She loves it and is 100% satisified with the product. I have purchased a few watches from shop nbc, so in turn she gets what she likes. thanks for such great products and also great prices, keep up the great work. ap
This was a gift for my son who has been using it since the day it arrived. He could tell you more about it. I only know that he believes it to be the best product for it's value.

Pros: Fast; Easy To Set Up; Easy To Use
The first one out of the box would lock up. Was on phone with support for them to tell me to take it back to Staples. Staples was nice and let me do this even thou it was out of the 14 day return policy. Got the new one and have not no problem with it. The tech at Staples said it looked like the wrong software was loaded on it at the factory. He got this because the software was T107 and the model I have is for T103

if you enjoy frustration and not being able to use a lot of the Android features, then this is perfect for you. Outdated tablet gives a website not avail or moved message for almost every web page you try to go to for apps. most notably the Android apps store. much more worth it to spend an extra couple bucks and buy a netbook.

ShopNBC customer service is the best, but this was not the toy for me. Doesn't support Adobe flash, Andriod apps are a no go, and to many steps to do for a "non-techy" to watch a movie or music so it was returned!

I was very pleased with this purchase. I looked at units that sold for $500+, but went with this one just to try out the tablet/E-reader format. Great for email, keeping track of your FACEBOOK page, music and pictures. Only a few negatives so far: video playback quality is not the greatest and the game selection also lacks....Overall for the price a good deal.

This was not my favorite purchase. the directions were complicated, the product was hard to use and certainly not user-friendly. The books available were nothing I wanted and the keyboard was hard to use. All in all, it was hard to return; there was no return label; shipping was expensive and I felt like my time and money were wasted! Should have stuck to brands I know!

Item.ReviewTitle: Great if your not looking for much!!
Item.Review: I would say that other than the screen locking up every once and a while this tablet is ok if you’re not looking for much functionality. The features are limited and not upgradeable. As a reader and once and a blue moon doing something else it more than adequate. I am not saying that you will be able to find any tablet that encompasses everything but the technology still needs to be tweaked on all. Great idea but I'll pay a little more for more features other than save a little to get a lot less. Thanks anyway, I returned mine. P.S. Battery life is spectacular

I was so excited to be getting this item because it seemed like such a good deal for the money. It stopped working within the first week. I never really got to explore all the things it did because it froze while loading the "user guide" page and never worked again. I called technical support and was told it must be defective. Next time, I'll just spend more and get the real thing!!

Item.ReviewTitle: could not access my email address
Item.Review: I couldn't access my email so no use in keeping it. I've spoken with Velocity Micro's tech support and I was told that this Android is not compatible with my email providers software or whatever. I had to return it. Sorry, I'm sure it's an excellent tablet.

I didnt need all of the bells and whistles that an Ipad had to offer so after reading reviews on this item I opted to purchase it. It does all I need to do and for a resonable price . Works great with my home wireless network and am able to get books from both Kindle and Borders. If want all the frills spend the extra bucks but if you need the basics this is the unit to buy

Item.ReviewTitle: Still new, but so far so good.
Item.Review:
I've only had my Velocity Micro Cruz 103 out of the box for about an hour or two, so I can't say that I've extensively road-tested it, BUT . . .
Negatives first: 1. There is no printed user guide or startup guide packed with the unit, so from the time you switch it on, you're on your own, until you figure out how to access the digital user guide loaded on the unit. 2. I ordered my unit on 2/11. It was not shipped until 2/18, and it did not arrive until 2/22. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Positives: 1. It was easy to connect to my wireless network, to load my e-mail account, open my Amazon Kindle account, and to synch picture and music files with my PC. 2. The screen is clear and easy to read. 3. The transaction time is pretty quick. 4. The accelerometer makes it easy to ... turn the unit on its side for a better view. 5. Widgets are easy to install. 6. Navigation (Back, Home Screen, etc.) is pretty simple. 7. It is substantial. Not a flimsy unit. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ In the coming week, I intend to use it more extensively, but at this point, I haven't had any problems, except starting it up, because there was no printed Quick Startup Guide included. expand » « collapse

I have been enjoying my velocity pad. At first I was had some issue wtih some programs loading. I searched the velocity web site and found the answer. When running some programs it a little slow but over all with what I paid for it I am enjoying it. It's not the ipad but close to it. I have no issue with getting to CNN, SHOPNBC,ESPN, etc. The wireless N on the component move fairly smoothly. I loaded a couple of videos today they look great, music sound great and I was able to load picture with no freezing issue. So I say if you are looking to woo people this is the cruz you need.

First off this thing has the weight of a brick. It is not light-weight at all very thick and bulky...that aside I could have lived with, but the wi-fi connected one time and that was it. Second, I could not get it to sink with my computer. Followed all the directions, etc., and still nothing. If you are looking for a lot of apps extra's on this - forget it, it also is not supported by the Android Apps store. Let's face it, the market if flooded not with Tablets that make all kinds of claims. This one, I would put on the bottom of the list - It is really not worth the money. I trust that others will be rewarded by it and fall in love with it, but I didn't, and I really wanted to. One of the main functions I am looking for is an eReader for books. That's it, and it failed for me on that issu ... e. expand » « collapse

I knew what I was buying prior to ordering, but for the low price, it does what it is supposed to do. I have a laptop to check email, though the Cruz will do it just fine, and it is ok for facebook. Where it excells is reading books, which is the reason I bought the device in the first place. Using the freeware program, Calibre, I can convert almost any document, txt, pdf and others, into mobi, and read through the kindle app. I fgive it a 4 star rating, and would recommend it to anyone wanting to read.

Item.ReviewTitle: Beware! No access to Android Marketplace
Item.Review:
Cons: No YouTube; No Android Marketplace; No flash
Because this device does not have access to the Android Marketplace, you cannot use Flash, which is the basis for many websites, including YouTube. The Cruz Marketplace did not contain the functionality I was looking for but did have links for pornographic apps. I returned mine because I did not think it was worth the price given these limitations.
I was very disappointed with this tablet, can not do half the things it says it does including watching videos etc. Wish I had returned it when I had the chance!! Please dont waste your money!!!!

This tablet is quite good looking and hefty feeling. The packaging is impressive too. My problem with it is the difficulty I am having in using its many features. I have gone thru the user guide several times but am not getting it to work as I feel it should. If I could get it to work as effortlessly, as the demonstrators did, I would be pleased. I haven't completely given up on it but am getting pretty close with my lack of success to date.

I love the Velosity Cruz. It is so convenient. I listen to all my music on it play games, email etc. Was amazed at how quickly it moves over the internet. Reading books is a Dream, so much easier carrying the Cruz than a thick book. Thank you so much!

I just wanted it to see what it was all about. It works fine. You cannot get downloads from the android market but that is fine as there are plenty of other downloads to get. Getting on the internet was very easy. The ereader is great. I can take this with me to play games while waiting at dr. office or just riding in car or bus. With the 4 and 8 gig sd cards there is plenty of storage. To bad there is no flash. But all in all it is an ok tablet

Item.ReviewTitle: Its alright for my daughter! She figured it out!
Item.Review: I bought this for myself but when I tried to use it I could not get anywhere with it, I could only get to a page that showed the lock and that was useless and everytime I tried to get anywhere else it would shut off or something. So I decided to let my daughter give it a try, At least she was able to manage using it. I found it hard to figure out and would recommend alot more help with instructions, I am not very computer friendly when it comes to a new device but found a different type that I have recently purchased from another place alot easier to use and figure out, So I am keeping it anyway as I did only manage to have my daughter get to try it on the day my payment was due! She likes it so I figured I would let her keep it until I purchase or my older daughter purchases her a compute ... r. expand » « collapse

I really enjoy my Cruiz tablet. It is very versitile with its Office Suite program and Oxford Dictionary. I am having a problem connecting with my wifi network at home because of a password issue which is not a problem with the tablet itself. When out at locations offering free wifi, I have no problem connecting to the internet and using the full features of my Cruiz tablet. I highly recommend it for anyone thinking of a future purchase.

I really like this product based on how it was advertised. Just remember that the quickest way to view applications is to download it on to the SD card first then insert it into Micro Cruz,and everything else is a "BREEZE" l LOVE IT!
Expected written instructions for operations, tablet was heavier than I expected, had problem accessing my emails, not user friendly for an over fifty non computer wiz. I am going to return unit.
I find this tablet difficult to maneuver. Thought it would be much more user friendly, and without internet access, its virtually useless . Will probably send it back.

I had to return the Velocity Micro Cruz because it malfuntion when I attempt totouch a app It would sometimes go to the App or it would reset it self I sent it to the SYSTEMAX TECHNOLOGY GROUP for a refund.

I'm happy with this. I don't use this for every single feature it has to be honest. However, I love amazon kindle, and using the tablet is perfect. I haven't had any problem obtaining books, bookmarking,etc. When I'm out, I can check my email and reply. Sometimes I feel like I have to type hard to email, but then I get into a groove and the letters start flowing. I don't need a data plan, it fits in my pocket book, so all is well. It's also fast. When I'm done reading a page, i give it a quick tap and the page turns. I haven't put pictures on yet, I did try once and had a problem. Didn't follow up yet, that's not that important to me. I have them on my cell phone. Be realistic about the price you are paying and what your needs truly are.

it's a cool tablet I'm disappointed that it don't have all the apps as the android phones. I would have loved to have been able to download the bible app on my cruz tablet for church, it would have made it easier for me to navigate through bible verses.

After reading the many negative reviews, I was pleasantly surprised to find that the tablet started working right out of the box. It immediately connected to my home wifi. It starts up faster than my laptop. It can be sluggish at times, but for what I ordered it for it seems to work fine. I have tried it at other locations with wifi and have had no trouble getting connected. Sometimes it will slow down and freeze, but if I go back to home and try again it works fine. I still prefer my kindle for reading and I have some great games on there, that I have not been able to get for the tablet. Alot of the android apps don't work. I wish I could find a good GPS app. Even though I was not able to get into my yahoo mail from the email icon, I can access the email by having yahoo as one of my bookm ... arks and going to mail from the yahoo home page. Overall I feel I got what I paid for. expand » « collapse
I love the cruz tablet, I can read eithout having to carrie the a big book. I enjoy easy way to use it and get from one thing to another. Also the price was great.

Item.ReviewTitle: Not as good as We thought
Item.Review: I bought this for my wife and she was just not impressed. The tablet was heavier than other tablets and the touch part was very slow in reacting to the touch of your finger. Nothing else worked at all. Besides all of that the one thing that was nice if you got the screen to react to your finger touch, you were able to connect the tablet to a server. I have a external hard drive connected to my router. It acts as a server and I was able to access it. You had to use the ip address of the ftp server side, butt was able to access it. If the Cruz would have a better reaction time for the touch screen, this would be a great product. It can do a lot more than other tablets. I returned my tablet and it has been over a week and my account has not been credited yet.

Item.ReviewTitle: Great Upgrade from just a eReader
Item.Review: Was interested in acquiring a portable notebook, ereader , etc. Saw this item on the air and immediately said, "This is for me!" I found the item to be very user friendly and an excellent size. It fits into my purse without a lot of excess weight. Had a question and called the Cruz technical phone number and was handled quickly and thoroughly. Am looking forward to lots of use in the future. Thanks for offering such good products!
I returned this product. It wasn't a smooth operation. I just didn't like the touch senisitvity, or the product responce. Returned as it would have been money thrown away.
FOR THE PRICE THIS UNIT IS SUPPER GREAT HAVE ONLY HAD IT FOR A MONTH BUT I AM SO PLEASED, BATTERY LIFE IS GRRRREAT, WI-FI WORKS JUST ABOUT WHERE EVER I GO, I'M LOVEING IT.

I`ve had this now for a month,,, and I am not very impressed with it. The operating system stops operating during downloads,, or reading emails. Clearing previous website histories is difficult and unreliable. The wifi range is dismally short. Apps close halfway through their use for no known reason. I dont like it and I want to return it.

after opening the box the 4gb sd card was not included but who uses that small of a card anyway. could not get the item to work called tec. support put on hold and than left a message it took 2 weeks before tec. returned the call so it just sat there does not work well with my computer and as a result I am returning it.

i bought this for my wife to help her spend her idle time at her job she has a lot of free time on her hands and it make for a long day she has been all this time trying to download a book she called the 800 number but they could care less about helping her so to say i am very disappointed with this is a understatement

When I received the Garmin I instantly put it to work. It really has been great because I don't have a GPS system in my car. Although I know my way around the city, there are a lot of places that I just don't know where they're located and this has really been a big help to me. I would suggest to anyone that don't know where a certain place is to get this. I'm glad I did!

One of my associates is very busy with work, family, volunteer work.....(just like all of us). Simplifying seemed important. (I saw her several appointment books for everything).
Once presented, she was thrilled and has been using it ever since.
I did return one for another associate....she had the "other one" presented to her by her husband.
Never the less, the product has received rave reviews from my associate!

I've been using my Velocity Micro Cruz T103 tablet now for a few weeks and I love it. I've been using it more than I do my regular computer.
When I first got it I was surprised to see how easy it was to set up right out of the box, the directions were right on the side of the box so it literally took me about 2 minutes to connect to my home network and start surfing the web.

small compact ,easy to carry around ,works like a regular computer again i'm impressed with this gadget (cruz) hear a new one about to be released offering more features; i 'am not concerned cause this one works. only thing (thought) worked a little slow but see the more apps down loaded the system seams to move work faster.also the resource inclinenation given for this purchase is most reliable the lord Jesus; so happens purchasing price unbeatable .

I was excited after viewing the sales preview on ShopNBC and didn't think twice about making the purchase. However, I felt that the instructions included with the tablet were not sufficient. I never could access all the programs. I returned the item after unsucessfully trying to access all the different applications, making attempts on several ocassions.

I was so excited when it arrived. However I was dissapointed in the product. There are words overlapping each other(hard to read). Some times it will work on first time other times it will not. The words do not fit into the box properly.Hard to read them. The only sound I get from the unit is the tapping sound when i use the keyboard.

This little item is great! After I got connected to the WiFi, I can bring up the net so easily and quickly with the Cruz tablet. Plan on 2 vacations this year and will definitely pack this to use on the plane. As a new user of any wireless product, I found I could get books to read, read Emails, watch videos and more! Thanks ShopNBC for bringing all the great items to our homes.

Item.ReviewTitle: Save your money and bypass the aggrivation
Item.Review: This is the worst product that I have ever received in my eight years of shopping with ShopNBC. I am unable to evaluate how it works because it would never turn on. After reading other reviews, I realize that a number of others have had this same problem. I was unable to check the Trouble Shooting Information in the User's Guide to see if I was doing anything wrong because the only user manual that is provided is not a hard paper copy but is part of the software that is factory loaded on the tablet. If you can't turn the tablet on, you don't have access to the instruction manual. Another negative is that for a tablet it is heavy at 1 lb. 2 oz. I gave it 1 star although it actually deserves 0 stars.

I ordered this as it was based on the "Android" OS. I have an Android Smart Phone and thought this would be loaded with the same features. Unfortunately it is not. I am probably going to return this as I am disappointed with the lack of apps for this. I must have 100 times more apps on my phone. This is good for emails and basic web browsing only.

The Cruz, this product is awsome I like the size, I do believe this product can do the sam as the ipad without the bigger size which is very nice, since I dont like to carry alot of things with me every where i go, it fits in my bag like a notebook, a great investment thankyou, it serves all my needs and adds the possibilities of more, again thankyou.ttnt

I don't know what I expected when I made this purchase. I was thrilled to see a tablet at such a reasonable price point and watching the presentation thought this could be perfect for me when I was away from my computer. What I did find out was that the Android Marketplace was not acceptable from the 2.0 OS. There was no way that you could upgrade and even if you could there was no deal with Google to use their programs!
The touch screen was not sensitive and needed to be pressed several times to get it to respond. The device did have a few pluses... Nice screen brightness and readable if you were using the device for a reader.
An okay device for the money. Slower than expected and does not have Android apps similar to my phone. Must say I was slightly disappointed, considering how well it performed on the tv demo.

This tablet is a waste of money. It does not have the android market and you cannot download the popular apps. There is no purpose for this tablet. I wish I did not waste my money on this product. It is worth it to spend more money on a better tablet because you are getting what you pay for. There is a reason why this one is so cheap. It does not do nearly what a good tablet does.

I was not happy with this product. I found the product to be slow, and the product was advertised with MS Office software installed; however, they neglected to mention that it was a trial version. In addition to that, I recently saw the product advertised for $30/$40 less than what I paid. I have returned the item.

More info was requierd. I am a hands on person, The info you get on the Cruz in in the tablet its self, I need to understand what it is I am trying to understand. But no books that explained what to do, trouble shoot ect. I don't think I read anywhere that I needed a wireless router. More information needs to be supplied.

This tablet will not check email from anyone other than Google. My husband bought it to carry with him on business trips instead of a laptop. He can't even check his company email. Will be returning ASAP.

Unfortunately, I didn't read reviews prior to placing order. Just went by TV demonstration. Tablet came with no directions. I coudn't get it powered up so I found instructions on line and printed 27 pages. After charging for 3 hrs. it came on briefly. It would not allow me to do anything from the home screen and after several trys tablet kept cutting off and finally would not power up at all. I don't know what was used on TV to demonstrate this product but it is not the product ShopNBC depicts. It was a complete waste of money.
I love this tablet! I've had absolutely no problem with this tablet. All of the functions respond very fast, and I am able to upload/download with no problem at all.

First, there were no directions with the unit so I tried to figure it out on my own.......no luck. I couldn't get the home page to come up at all. Then when I tried to turn it off and back on thinking that might help, it wouldn't stay on! Decided after about 30 minutes of tinkering with this loser to send it right back. What a waste of time!!

I ordered two of these tablets, one shipped and one didn't that was the first problem. The day the tablet arrived last week I absolutely loved it until the next morning I went to use it and it was frozen. The reset didn't work so I called Cruz technical support and was told the harddrive was bad. I returned the tablet immediately. I am willing to try this again as I sit and wait for the second one to arrive hoping it is better than the first one.

Item.ReviewTitle: not worth the money for somthing that do not work
Item.Review: i work on this thing half the the night when i turn it on it acting if it was a tv with out cable the screen was going crazy and frying and runing so all different colors i was abl to reset it and it was doing the same thing this is the worst the thing yet that i have got from shop n b n and it is verry verry heavy and hard to get it to work so i had to sent it back so i want be buying another table for a while this is the third one that i had to send back. shop n b c should not send out junk like this they should check out their tablets before sending it out so far this is the worse one yet so keep in mine i am not saying that all o f them are like this but this one was i pice of junk hope some one get one that work it did not work for me and the custom service rep ask was if it was that ... i did not now to work it i have a degree in electronics i know what i was doing i verry much this was a hi price of junk expand » « collapse

I purchased the CRUZ ereader and have enjoyed being able to download books and search the internet. It is slower than I expected to search the internet, but for a hand held device I think it works great.

This item has minimal functionality outside of reading books. To call it an Android Tablet is VERY misleading. How can you sell an Android tablet and not have access to the single most popular Android App out there (Android Market)?! CruzMarket is a Joke! Completely useless. The hacked e-reader I have now works 10 times better. The first review says it all. Prepare to be underwhelmed. I am returning this e-reader and purchasing a tablet.

Received my Cruz tablet yesterday, I didn't get a chance to play with it until tonight. I turned it on, it wouldn't power on, so I charged it. It still wouldn't power on, then I reset it. It Finally came on and now it is stuck on the time date screen. I went to the Velocity website, saw that support was open til 8pm, called them,stayed on the phone for about 45 minutes, they closed without taking my call. Will be sendiing it back ASAP

It doesn't run as fast as it showed on the video presentation but perhaps that's because I (and you?) may need a Wireless N Router, I don't know. I'm a computer and gadget gal and it wasn't very intuitive out of the box. It defaults to not downloading 3rd party apps but Micro Cruz Marketplace has 3rd party apps. It's heavy and doesn't run flash so your Facebook experience is very basic. (No Zynga games, etc.) No texting app, webpages load slowly, and the word processing and productivity tools you have to eventually pay for. To me, it's a fancy E-Reader. I didn't even try getting into the E-Reading because I'm not interested in it. The touch screen is OK. You have to press hard at times and sometimes it it's too touchy. I love Shop NBC and feel bad leaving a bad review, ... but maybe this will work for you and is what you are looking for. Great for a kid for media- like pics, videos, etc. It's just not what I was looking for. expand » « collapse

I bought this because I'd done a bunch of research on tablets and saw a lot of hype and anticipation over the release of the Cruz Tablet. Then I saw here on ShopNBC. So I jumped at it.
There are a couple of positives about it:
1) It looks nice. I doesn't look cheap or cheesy like some of the other tablets. The lines are clean and the controls are where you'd expect them.
2) Battery life is awesome. I pretty much played with mine out of the box for hours.
Other than that, I can't think of much that was good enough to comment on.
Now for the negatives:
1) CRUZ Market. It's a joke. The apps are provided by a freeware site, not affiliated with CRUZ in any way. About 75% of the "apps" are web based apps -- not standalone. The one app that is available f ... rom CRUZ (YouTube) is only available if you go to their support web site and download it onto a desktop computer first. I attempted to D/L it from within the CRUZ tablet -- it failed.
2) MIPS CPU. Most other Androids use an ARM CPU. The MIPS CPU in this means several things: a) Hacking it is nearly impossible (You can _never_ get Android Market because it depends on shared libraries that are for an ARM only) b) You will _never_ see an upgrade to Android 2.1, 2.2, or 3.0. c) that also means you'll never have Flash. d) can you say "slow?"
3) Memory size. The documentation is misleading (to me anyway). I thought there was an internal 4GB SD card and an external 8GB SD card. There is only one SD slot and both cards are external. If you need to swap the cards, you have to quit all the applications that depend on any data on the current card, or you risk corrupting your card. Not all the applications have a "quit" option, so you need to get a 3rd party app the will kill other apps.
4) The screen. There are several things I don't like about the screen. It's not responsive. For a capacitive screen, it sure acts like it's resistive. Even if you're careful and use just your pinky nail, you can frequently select the wrong th ... expand » « collapse

Pros: Easy To Set Up; Fast; Easy To Use
it needs a little practice but it is worth the time it takes 50 seconds to load the programs, i downloaded some free books and read two the screen responds well right touch to advance left to go back etc. for the price it is a great deal even if it was used only as a reader but it has much more,the screen is crisp all functions work well except youtube but there is a fix for that on the net,so all in all a great buy
The price is just right, the size and handling of the tablet is well built.
I have tried many android tablets and for the price this one is clear and fast and very easy to use.
thought it was me but its not thing freezes the sound doesn't work even with headphones touchpad is sloppy at best so sorry I bought it..
It serves the purpose of checking email,downloading apps, or just enjoying your fav music on the go. Good little tablet for the price.
I like my CRUZ although its weight could be less its very portable and the apps are nice.
can use this for backup when others are down...Very much enjoy it. Something exciting and the price is better....
I like the tablet; but it is a little heavy for a female to hold for extended period. However all in all it is a great product for the price.
It was easy to get started using it Nice features lightweight tablet Easy wireless setup Expandable storage
like the others said, it is slow and hard to use, will keep but give to a kid as a toy to play with.....
easy to use, great support from company, have not yet used all applications but the ones i have were simple to access, quick response to the touch
Very good value for the money. Works as expected. The prices are better than or comparable to the "Big Box" stores".
I have returned my purchase because I did not find it to be really easy to use.
Works good, easy to learn and suspect to be very usufull as time goes by. Have not had the tablet that long but have enjoyed my new product.
I am really enjoying the CruzT103. It is very easy to use. i like that it came charged up so I could play with it right out of the box. thanks.

Pros: Fast; Easy To Use; Easy To Set Up; Powerful
Great to read books online!
Ok, I wouldnt suggest buying this. Not worth the money.
A little heavy for everyday use but the kids love it on trips.
a. no instructions; b. screen touch was either over sensitive or would not work; c. screen would smear with every touch; d. over priced.
really like it , still trying to figure out how to work all the apps. enjoying playing with it to see what all it can do.
Sent back not what expected ran older Androd found better tablet cheaper and newer operating system over priced.
it was hard to manage, it keep freezing, not recommend for children under 10, or even some adults, it should be easy to operate, but isn't
Granddaughter uses tablet every day and she loves it.Nice size screen.
So far its very nice. I have only had it for a short time.
not what i thought cant play games no flash drive ok for a reader or surfing web but not for what i needed it for
Unfortunately I didnt read the reviews before I purchased this item. Does not perform the way presented, dont bother!! Sent it back!!
Not a fast response to the touch. It's also too heavy. Get tire easy when hold.
Me and my family love this..I love reading my lastest books..I don't leave home without it...
This tablet is NOT compatible with Yahoo! It is kind of slow, but has a great dictionary .
It's driving us nuts trying to figure this thing out, with all the passwords required. Still don't know where to obtain the necessary passwords.

Item.ReviewTitle: I AM NOT VERY SATISFIED WITH THE PRODUCT
Item.Review: I AM NOT VERY SATISFIED WITH THE PRODUCT. PRODUCT IS NOT CUSTOMER FRIENDLY AS FOR AS USE. DOCUMENTATION WAS INSUFFICIENT.
it was better than i expected. i have been learning how to use it. great experience. i enjoy it very much.
First time buyer. It works great for me the beginner.

Item.ReviewTitle: NOT Worth Its' Weight in Gold
Item.Review: Even if all the (many) legit issues listed by other reviewers and the technical issues I experienced were non-existent, the tablet is simply to heavy.
I have only that this tablet from 30 days. I know it does not work. I can get to come on. Please do not waste your time.
i try two tablets before and i returned,,but this iten is very good
very slow no applications obsolete before it was shipped. Returned it. If you want a pretty brick buy bricks instead. This a total waste
Sent it back, not happy with the way it works has to be a better one out there!
I got this for my soon to be 15 yr old son.He loves it,so do i.Thanks
I received this and after a few days of trying to utilize it realized it wasn't what it was made out to be and sent it back.
Gave to my brother for a gift. He loves it very much. Thanks!
Not what I expected. Not what the tv showed it to be. More complicated than as shown on tv. Would have been better off paying for a real board.
I bought two of them, sending them both back..junk! I've bought countless items from Shop NBC, and never had an expeirence like this...
